channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: CENet: Toward Concise and Efficient LiDAR Semantic Segmentation for Autonomous Driving
item.description: Accurate and fast scene understanding is one of the challenging task for autonomous driving, which requires to take full advantage of LiDAR point clouds for semantic segmentation.

item.title: Few-shot Learning with Class-Covariance Metric for Hyperspectral Image Classification
item.description: Recently, embedding and metric-based few-shot learning (FSL) has been introduced into hyperspectral image classification (HSIC) and achieved impressive progress.

item.title: LaKo: Knowledge-driven Visual Question Answering via Late Knowledge-to-Text Injection
item.description: Visual question answering (VQA) often requires an understanding of visual concepts and language semantics, which relies on external knowledge.

item.title: Learning Visual Representation from Modality-Shared Contrastive Language-Image Pre-training
item.description: Large-scale multi-modal contrastive pre-training has demonstrated great utility to learn transferable features for a range of downstream tasks by mapping multiple modalities into a shared embedding space.

item.title: Generalized Probabilistic U-Net for medical image segementation
item.description: We propose the Generalized Probabilistic U-Net, which extends the Probabilistic U-Net by allowing more general forms of the Gaussian distribution as the latent space distribution that can better approximate the uncertainty in the reference segmentations.

item.title: Cross-Modality Image Registration using a Training-Time Privileged Third Modality
item.description: In this work, we consider the task of pairwise cross-modality image registration, which may benefit from exploiting additional images available only at training time from an additional modality that is different to those being registered.

item.title: Bilateral Self-unbiased Learning from Biased Implicit Feedback
item.description: Implicit feedback has been widely used to build commercial recommender systems.

item.title: Repeated Environment Inference for Invariant Learning
item.description: The EI step uses a reference model which focuses on spurious correlations to efficiently reach a good environment partition.

item.title: Large-displacement 3D Object Tracking with Hybrid Non-local Optimization
item.description: Optimization-based 3D object tracking is known to be precise and fast, but sensitive to large inter-frame displacements.

item.title: Representing Random Utility Choice Models with Neural Networks
item.description: Motivated by the successes of deep learning, we propose a class of neural network-based discrete choice models, called RUMnets, which is inspired by the random utility maximization (RUM) framework.

item.title: A Reliable Online Method for Joint Estimation of Focal Length and Camera Rotation
item.description: Linear perspectivecues deriving from regularities of the built environment can be used to recalibrate both intrinsic and extrinsic camera parameters online, but these estimates can be unreliable due to irregularities in the scene, uncertainties in line segment estimation and background clutter.

item.title: Learning Hierarchy Aware Features for Reducing Mistake Severity
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel approach for learning Hierarchy Aware Features (HAF) that leverages classifiers at each level of the hierarchy that are constrained to generate predictions consistent with the label hierarchy.

item.title: Semi-supervised 3D Object Detection with Proficient Teachers
item.description: To reduce the dependence on large supervision, semi-supervised learning (SSL) based approaches have been proposed.

item.title: Compositional Human-Scene Interaction Synthesis with Semantic Control
item.description: Furthermore, inspired by the compositional nature of interactions that humans can simultaneously interact with multiple objects, we define interaction semantics as the composition of varying numbers of atomic action-object pairs.

item.title: SPAIC: A Spike-based Artificial Intelligence Computing Framework
item.description: In this work, we present a Python based spiking neural network (SNN) simulation and training framework, aka SPAIC that aims to support brain-inspired model and algorithm researches integrated with features from both deep learning and neuroscience.

item.title: Domain Adaptation under Open Set Label Shift
item.description: We introduce the problem of domain adaptation under Open Set Label Shift (OSLS) where the label distribution can change arbitrarily and a new class may arrive during deployment, but the class-conditional distributions p(x|y) are domain-invariant.

item.title: Learning Protein Representations via Complete 3D Graph Networks
item.description: Our ProNet is very flexible and can be used to compute protein representations at different levels of granularity.

item.title: Criteria Comparative Learning for Real-scene Image Super-Resolution
item.description: Inspired by the observation that the contrastive relationship could also exist between the criteria, in this work, we propose a novel training paradigm for RealSR, named Criteria Comparative Learning (Cria-CL), by developing contrastive losses defined on criteria instead of image patches.

item.title: Visually explaining 3D-CNN predictions for video classification with an adaptive occlusion sensitivity analysis
item.description: The key idea here is to occlude a specific volume of data by a 3D mask in an input 3D temporal-spatial data space and then measure the change degree in the output score.

item.title: ProposalContrast: Unsupervised Pre-training for LiDAR-based 3D Object Detection
item.description: Existing approaches for unsupervised point cloud pre-training are constrained to either scene-level or point/voxel-level instance discrimination.

item.title: S-Prompts Learning with Pre-trained Transformers: An Occam's Razor for Domain Incremental Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose one simple paradigm (named as S-Prompting) and two concrete approaches to highly reduce the forgetting degree in one of the most typical continual learning scenarios, i. e., domain increment learning (DIL).

item.title: MV-FCOS3D++: Multi-View Camera-Only 4D Object Detection with Pretrained Monocular Backbones
item.description: In this technical report, we present our solution, dubbed MV-FCOS3D++, for the Camera-Only 3D Detection track in Waymo Open Dataset Challenge 2022.

item.title: NewsStories: Illustrating articles with visual summaries
item.description: Thus, we explore a novel setting where the goal is to learn a self-supervised visual-language representation that is robust to varying text length and the number of images.

item.title: Lifelong DP: Consistently Bounded Differential Privacy in Lifelong Machine Learning
item.description: In this paper, we show that the process of continually learning new tasks and memorizing previous tasks introduces unknown privacy risks and challenges to bound the privacy loss.

item.title: Text-Guided Synthesis of Artistic Images with Retrieval-Augmented Diffusion Models
item.description: In RDMs, a set of nearest neighbors is retrieved from an external database during training for each training instance, and the diffusion model is conditioned on these informative samples.

item.title: Towards Smart City Security: Violence and Weaponized Violence Detection using DCNN
item.description: In this ever connected society, CCTVs have had a pivotal role in enforcing safety and security of the citizens by recording unlawful activities for the authorities to take actions.

item.title: Hansel: A Chinese Few-Shot and Zero-Shot Entity Linking Benchmark
item.description: We then establish a strong baseline that scores a R@1 of 46. 2% on Few-Shot and 76. 6% on Zero-Shot on our dataset.

item.title: Controllable User Dialogue Act Augmentation for Dialogue State Tracking
item.description: Prior work has demonstrated that data augmentation is useful for improving dialogue state tracking.

item.title: V$^2$L: Leveraging Vision and Vision-language Models into Large-scale Product Retrieval
item.description: While model ensemble is common, we show that combining the vision models and vision-language models brings particular benefits from their complementarity and is a key factor to our superiority.

item.title: Learning Bipedal Walking On Planned Footsteps For Humanoid Robots
item.description: To enable the application of RL policies for humanoid robots in real-world settings, it is crucial to build a system that can achieve robust walking in any direction, on 2D and 3D terrains, and be controllable by a user-command.

item.title: Bundle MCR: Towards Conversational Bundle Recommendation
item.description: MCR, which uses a conversational paradigm to elicit user interests by asking user preferences on tags (e. g., categories or attributes) and handling user feedback across multiple rounds, is an emerging recommendation setting to acquire user feedback and narrow down the output space, but has not been explored in the context of bundle recommendation.

item.title: Efficient One Pass Self-distillation with Zipf's Label Smoothing
item.description: This paper proposes an efficient self-distillation method named Zipf's Label Smoothing (Zipf's LS), which uses the on-the-fly prediction of a network to generate soft supervision that conforms to Zipf distribution without using any contrastive samples or auxiliary parameters.

item.title: Monocular 3D Object Detection with Depth from Motion
item.description: Perceiving 3D objects from monocular inputs is crucial for robotic systems, given its economy compared to multi-sensor settings.

item.title: OpenRAN Gym: AI/ML Development, Data Collection, and Testing for O-RAN on PAWR Platforms
item.description: In this paper we present OpenRAN Gym, a unified, open, and O-RAN-compliant experimental toolbox for data collection, design, prototyping and testing of end-to-end data-driven control solutions for next generation Open RAN systems.

item.title: CelebV-HQ: A Large-Scale Video Facial Attributes Dataset
item.description: Large-scale datasets have played indispensable roles in the recent success of face generation/editing and significantly facilitated the advances of emerging research fields.

item.title: GNN Transformation Framework for Improving Efficiency and Scalability
item.description: We propose a framework that automatically transforms non-scalable GNNs into precomputation-based GNNs which are efficient and scalable for large-scale graphs.

item.title: Improving Pseudo Labels With Intra-Class Similarity for Unsupervised Domain Adaptation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel approach to improve the accuracy of the pseudo labels in the target domain.

item.title: Trainability Preserving Neural Structured Pruning
item.description: In this paper, we present trainability preserving pruning (TPP), a regularization-based structured pruning method that can effectively maintain trainability during sparsification.

item.title: WinoGAViL: Gamified Association Benchmark to Challenge Vision-and-Language Models
item.description: While vision-and-language models perform well on tasks such as visual question answering, they struggle when it comes to basic human commonsense reasoning skills.

item.title: Label Uncertainty Modeling and Prediction for Speech Emotion Recognition using t-Distributions
item.description: To address this, these emotion annotations are typically collected by multiple annotators and averaged across annotators in order to obtain labels for arousal and valence.

item.title: SecretGen: Privacy Recovery on Pre-Trained Models via Distribution Discrimination
item.description: We first explore different statistical information which can discriminate the private training distribution from other distributions.

item.title: Improving Adversarial Robustness via Mutual Information Estimation
item.description: To alleviate this negative effect, in this paper, we investigate the dependence between outputs of the target model and input adversarial samples from the perspective of information theory, and propose an adversarial defense method.

item.title: Differential testing for machine learning: an analysis for classification algorithms beyond deep learning
item.description: The execution of the feasible tests revealed that there is a large amount of deviations for the scores and classes.

item.title: MAPIE: an open-source library for distribution-free uncertainty quantification
item.description: Estimating uncertainties associated with the predictions of Machine Learning (ML) models is of crucial importance to assess their robustness and predictive power.

item.title: Developing Optimal Causal Cyber-Defence Agents via Cyber Security Simulation
item.description: In this paper we explore cyber security defence, through the unification of a novel cyber security simulator with models for (causal) decision-making through optimisation.

item.title: Black-box Few-shot Knowledge Distillation
item.description: Traditional KD methods require lots of labeled training samples and a white-box teacher (parameters are accessible) to train a good student.

item.title: Calibrated One-class Classification for Unsupervised Time Series Anomaly Detection
item.description: Our one-class classifier is calibrated in two ways: (1) by adaptively penalizing uncertain predictions, which helps eliminate the impact of anomaly contamination while accentuating the predictions that the one-class model is confident in, and (2) by discriminating the normal samples from native anomaly examples that are generated to simulate genuine time series abnormal behaviors on the basis of original data.

item.title: TransCL: Transformer Makes Strong and Flexible Compressive Learning
item.description: Compressive learning (CL) is an emerging framework that integrates signal acquisition via compressed sensing (CS) and machine learning for inference tasks directly on a small number of measurements.

item.title: Intention-Conditioned Long-Term Human Egocentric Action Forecasting @ EGO4D Challenge 2022
item.description: Our framework first extracts two level of human information over the N observed videos human actions through a Hierarchical Multi-task MLP Mixer (H3M).

item.title: What is Healthy? Generative Counterfactual Diffusion for Lesion Localization
item.description: This requires training with healthy and unhealthy data in DPMs.
